# Where Business Feels  
Right at Home.

Read More

#### Locate Here

From finding the ideal site to filling workforce needs, we mobilize our
connections for you.

#### Grow Here

The opportunities and connections you need.

#### Launch Here

Whatever your stage, you’re in the right place.

###### Savannah Chatham Manufacturing Center

774 Acre Industrial Development Park

Learn More

### Workforce at a glance

463,000

**available workforce  
within a 60-mile radius**

4,000

**military members transition to  
civilian workforce annually**

78,000+

**students pursuing higher  
education at 17 colleges  
and universities**

##### You’re not here by accident.  
You’re here with a purpose.

To find a place that’s different than the rest. Ideally located on the
Atlantic Ocean, the Savannah region is home to more than one million people
and a skilled workforce that includes more than 4,000 military transitioning
to the civil sector each year. Our 16 area colleges and universities with more
than 74,000 students are producing a top talented workforce in industries
ranging from creative technologies, entertainment production and advanced
manufacturing and more. In addition, the region has programs like Quick Start,
the state’s number one workforce training program in the United States.

The Port of Savannah’s global carrier network and superior location means
faster-to-market service providing vital links to U.S. and international
markets through two Class I railroads on terminal and Interstates 95 and 16
that can reach key cities throughout the U.S. in one- to two-day drives.

SEDA is here to help propel your business. If you are looking to locate to the
region we can offer creative solutions, connections and resources.  And we
firmly believe in “services after the sale.” Our award-winning business
retention and expansion team will be here with you every step of the way as
you grow in Savannah.

Contact us today.

Read More

**Savannah Chatham Manufacturing Center**

The Savannah Economic Development Authority’s Savannah Chatham Manufacturing
Center is your new home for advanced manufacturing.

See For Yourself



### Savannah’s Infrastructure at a Glance



**one of the hottest industrial real estate markets in the country**

#1

**largest single container terminal and fastest-growing container terminal in
the nation**

2

**Class I railroads  
on terminal at the  
Port of Savannah**

32

**non-stop destinations at  
Savannah-Hilton Head  
International Airport**

Read More

###### Advanced Manufacturing

We were made for this.

###### Aerospace

Savannah is a central hub to the nation's top aerospace manufacturers.

###### Electric Vehicle Manufacturing

In 2022, Hyundai Motor Group electrified the Savannah region.

###### Logistics & Distribution

Fueled by the Port of Savannah, the distribution sector of Savannah’s economy
is booming.

###### Entertainment Production

From beaches to high rises, the Savannah region can provide it all for the
entertainment production industry.

###### Technology & Innovation

Where creatives, technologists and entrepreneurs create, code & collide.

###### Health Tech

Savannah is a regional healthcare hub for 35 counties.

###### Specialty Food & Beverage Manufacturing

Savannah has the infrastructure to push product to market.

> "Continued investments in state-of-the-art products, modern customer support
> facilities and our communities sets Gulfstream apart in our industry, and we
> are grateful to our partners at the Savannah/Hilton Head airport, the
> Savannah Economic Development Authority and the Georgia Department of
> Economic Development, among others, for their support for our growth in the
> region."

Gulfstream Aerospace President Mark Burns

> "With our experience in developing and producing parts, it is an honor to be
> able to supply electric vehicle parts in Chatham County, Georgia. With the
> establishment of Seoyon E-Hwa Savannah, we hope that it will not only
> provide new jobs in the region but also contribute to making Savannah a
> central city for automobile development and production."

Seoyon E-HWA Chairman Ryu Yang-seok

> “It is an honor for PHA to establish a new production facility in Chatham
> County, Georgia. As a producer of innovative products for the automotive
> world and growing EV market, we are extremely excited to be a part of the
> community. We owe our sincere gratitude to Chatham County and the State of
> Georgia for their support in making this happen and launching a successful
> partnership that will bring new jobs and contribute to advancing the
> economic development of the entire region.”

PHA Chairman Sangtae Kim

> "SEDA is a terrific silent warrior for the Savannah area. They rolled up
> their sleeves and put forth some very creative offers that we just couldn’t
> refuse in order to keep Byrd and our expansion here in beautiful Savannah,
> Georgia. I’m deeply grateful for their support and encouragement."

Byrd Cookie Company CEO Stephanie Lindley

> “We chose the right site, the right partners and the right state for
> progress.”

Hyundai Motor Group Executive Chairman Euisun Chang

> "Continued investments in state-of-the-art products, modern customer support
> facilities and our communities sets Gulfstream apart in our industry, and we
> are grateful to our partners at the Savannah/Hilton Head airport, the
> Savannah Economic Development Authority and the Georgia Department of
> Economic Development, among others, for their support for our growth in the
> region."

Gulfstream Aerospace President Mark Burns

> "With our experience in developing and producing parts, it is an honor to be
> able to supply electric vehicle parts in Chatham County, Georgia. With the
> establishment of Seoyon E-Hwa Savannah, we hope that it will not only
> provide new jobs in the region but also contribute to making Savannah a
> central city for automobile development and production."

Seoyon E-HWA Chairman Ryu Yang-seok

> “It is an honor for PHA to establish a new production facility in Chatham
> County, Georgia. As a producer of innovative products for the automotive
> world and growing EV market, we are extremely excited to be a part of the
> community. We owe our sincere gratitude to Chatham County and the State of
> Georgia for their support in making this happen and launching a successful
> partnership that will bring new jobs and contribute to advancing the
> economic development of the entire region.”

> their sleeves and put forth some very creative offers that we just couldn’t
> refuse in order to keep Byrd and our expansion here in beautiful Savannah,

### Latest News

##### SEDA hosts 2024 annual meeting

01.09.2024

On Jan. 4,  at the Savannah Economic Development Authority (SEDA) Annual
Meeting SEDA President and CEO Trip Tollison announced that the authority had
facilitated 11 company announcements in 2023 that resulted in 3,731 new job
opportunities and $2,631,994,199 in capital investment. Other highlights of
the event included announcing the naming…

Read More

##### Plastic Express to double Georgia operations

11.30.2023

Governor Brian P. Kemp today announced that Plastic Express, a leader in the
plastic resins shipping industry, will build a second shipping facility in
Savannah, Georgia. The new location will create an estimated 200 new jobs and
$80 million in investment in Chatham County. “Job creators like Plastic
Express choose…

Read More
